Introduction.Name: High Elves

Magic.Name: The Lore of High Magic
Magic.Alternative: Any of eight Lore of Battle Magic

Introduction.Annotation: The High Elves, or the Asur, as they call themselves, are one of the most ancient and powerful mortal civilisations within the Warhammer World. Hailing from a mighty mist-shrouded island-continent located within the centre of the Great Ocean, the High Elves of Ulthuan are a proud and mighty nation of masterful warriors, peerless mages and lords of the sky and sea. They are an ancient race with powerful armies and even grander magic, building a grand and all-mighty civilisation who, alongside the Dwarfs, fought a long-forgotten, apocalyptic war which saw some of the greatest and most powerful mortal heroes battle against the great darkness that tried to consume the world many thousands of years ago. At the zenith of their power, the world was truly theirs for the taking.

Artefact.Name: Blade of Leaping Gold
Artefact.Rule: Any roll of 6 To Wound ignores armour saves
Artefact.Description: The Blade of Leaping Gold grants the wielder +3 Attacks. In addition, any roll of 6 To Wound made with the Blade of Leaping Gold ignores armour saves.

Artefact.Name: Star Lance
Artefact.Rule: Armour saves cannot be taken on the turn he charges
Artefact.Description: Mounted character only. The Star Lance can only be used in a turn in which the bearer makes a successful charge. Attacks with the Star Lance are resolved at +3 Strength, and armour saves cannot be taken against Wounds caused by the Star Lance. If the bearer did not make a successful charge this turn, or if his mount has been slain, he must instead fight using another weapon.

Artefact.Name: Reaver bow
Artefact.Rule: Longbow with range 30", +1 Strength, Volley Fire and Multiple Shots(3)
Artefact.Description: Longbow with range 30", +1 Strength, Volley Fire and Multiple Shots(3).

Artefact.Name: Armour of Caledor
Artefact.Rule: Fireborn
Artefact.Description: The Armour of Caledor grants the wearer a 2+ Armour save that cannot be improved by any means. In addition, the Armour of Caledor grants the bearer a 6+ Ward save and the Fireborn special ride.

Artefact.Name: Shadow Armour
Artefact.Rule: Scout
Strider
Artefact.Description: Model on foot only. The wearer of the Shadow Armour has a 5+ Armour save. In addition, the wearer has both the Scouts and Strider special rules.

Artefact.Name: Shield of the Merwyrm
Artefact.Rule: Parry save of 4+
Artefact.Description: Shield. Unless he is fighting with a weapon that has the Requires Two Hands special rule, the bearer of the Shield of the Merwyrm has a parry save of 4+ (even if he's fighting with a magic weapon).

Artefact.Name: Golden Crown of Atrazar
Artefact.Description: One use only. The Golden Crown of Atrazar bestows a 2+ Ward save against the first wounding hit suffered by the wearer (which cancels out not only the Wound, but also any Killing Blow or Multiple Wounds special rules the attack has) after which its power fades and it cannot be used again during the game.

Artefact.Name: Moranion's Wayshard
Artefact.Rule: Ambushers
Artefact.Description: Model on foot only. The bearer of Moranion's Wayshard has the Ambushers special rule. He can also give the Ambushers special rule to a friendly Archers or Spearmen unit, up to 30 models in size and chosen from Warhammer: High Elves, immediately before deployment. If he does so, he immediately joins the unit and cannot leave it until the turn after the one in which the combined unit has deployed.

Artefact.Name: Khaine's Ring of Fury
Artefact.Rule: Bound spell, Power level 3: Soul Quench spell
Artefact.Description: Bound spell (power level 3). Khaine's Ring of Fury contains the Soul Quench spell (see the Lore of High Magic).

Artefact.Name: Gem Ofsunfire
Artefact.Rule: Once per battle, all of the bearer's spells, shooting attacks and close combat attacks have a +1 bonus To Wound and Flaming Attacks special rule
Artefact.Description: One use only. During the turn in which the Gem of Sunfire is used, all of the bearer's spells, shooting attacks and close combat attacks (and his mount's, if he has one) have a +1 bonus To Wound (rolls of 1 still fail) provided that they also have the Flaming Attacks special rule.

Artefact.Name: Cloak of Beards
Artefact.Rule: Against Dwarfs causes Terror
All Dwarfs gain the Hatred special rule while attacking the model
Artefact.Description: The wearer of the Cloak of Beards causes Fear. Against models chosen from Warhammer: Dwarfs, the wearer causes Terror instead. However, all models from Warhammer: Dwarfs gain the Hatred special rule while attacking the wearer. In addition, at the start of each Close Combat phase, roll a D6 for each magic item carried by each model from Warhammer: Dwarfs that is in base contact with the bearer. On a roll of 4+, that magic item is destroyed and cannot be used for the rest of the batde. Note that this has no effect on magic items that are mounts, magic items that contain bound spells that have already miscast during the game, and any magic items labelled as 'one use only' that have already been used during the game — do not roll to see if these magic items are destroyed.

Artefact.Name: Book of Hoeth
Artefact.Rule: May re-roll a single dice from each of his casting or dispel attempts
Artefact.Description: The Book of Hoeth allows the bearer to re-roll a single dice from each of his casting or dispel attempts. Results of 6 cannot be re-rolled.

Artefact.Name: Banner of the World Dragon
Artefact.Rule: 2+ Ward save against all Wounds caused by spells, magic weapons and magical attacks
All Dragons within 12" have the Stubborn special rule
Artefact.Description: All models in a unit that carries the Banner of the World Dragon have a 2+ Ward save against all Wounds caused by spells, magic weapons and magical attacks. Furthermore, all Dragons (friend or foe) within 12" of the Banner of the World Dragon have the Stubborn special rule.

Artefact.Name: Helm of Discord
Artefact.Description: The wearer counts his armour save as being one point higher than normal. In addition, at the start of each Close Combat phase, choose an enemy character in base contact with the bearer or his unit. That character must immediately take a Leadership test. If the test is failed, the character succumbs to the helm's sibilant whispers of malice and jealousy. In this Close Combat phase, the victim cannot make attacks and is hit automatically.

Artefact.Name: Wizarding Hat
Artefact.Description: The wearer is treated as being a Level 2 Wizard who can use a randomly chosen spell lore. However, he also has the Stupidity special rule.

Artefact.Name: Fozzrik's Folding Fortress
Artefact.Rule: After deployment zones have been agreed, but before the armies have been deployed, place a watchtower building in your deployment zone to represent rhe Folding Fortress
Artefact.Description: After deployment zones have been agreed, but before the armies have been deployed, place a watchtower building (or scratch-built structure of a similar size) in your deployment zone to represent rhe Folding Fortress. This is treated as a standard building. If you do not have a suitable building to place, you cannot use Fozzrik's Folding Fortress.

Artefact.Name: Arabyan Carpet
Artefact.Rule: Fly
Artefact.Description: Infantry or monstrous infantry models on foot only. The owner of this magical carpet has the Fly special rule. However, he cannot join units.

Artefact.Name: Crown of Command
Artefact.Description: The bearer of the Crown of Command has the Stubborn special rule.

Artefact.Name: Healing Potion
Artefact.Rule: Once per battle recovers D6 Wounds lost in the battle
Artefact.Description: One use only. The Healing Potion can be drunk at the start of the controlling player's turn. The imbiber immediately recovers D6 Wounds lost in the battle.

Artefact.Name: Featherfoe Torc
Artefact.Rule: Flying creatures (and their riders) must re-roll successful rolls to hit against the bearer (and any unit he is with) in close combat
Artefact.Description: Flying creatures (and their riders) must re-roll successful rolls to hit against the bearer (and any unit he is with) in close combat.

Artefact.Name: Ruby Ring of Ruin
Artefact.Rule: Bound spell, Power level 3: Fireball spell from Lore of Fire
Artefact.Description: Bound spell (power level 3). The Ruby Ring of Ruin contains the Fireball spell (see the Lore of Fire).

Artefact.Name: The Terrifying Mask of Eee!
Artefact.Description: The wearer of this mask causes Terror. However, other models can never use his Leadership.

Artefact.Name: Potion of Strength
Artefact.Rule: Once per battle at the start of any player's turn has +3 Strength until the end of the turn
Artefact.Description: One use only. The Potion of Strength can be drunk at the start of any player's turn. The imbiber has +3 Strength until the end of the turn.

Artefact.Name: Potion of Toughness
Artefact.Rule: Once per battle at the start of any player's turn has +3 Toughness until the end of the turn
Artefact.Description: One use only. The Potion of Toughness can be drunk at the start of any player's turn. The imbiber has +3 Toughness until the end of the turn.

Artefact.Name: The Other Trickster's Shard
Artefact.Description: Models in base contact with the bearer (friends and foes) must re-roll successful ward saves.

Artefact.Name: Ironcurse Icon
Artefact.Rule: The character (and any unit he is with) have 6+ Ward save against war machine weapons
Artefact.Description: The character (and any unit he is with) gain a 6+ ward save against war machine weapons.

Artefact.Name: Potion of Foolhardiness
Artefact.Rule: Once per battle character has the Immune to Psychology and the Devastating Charge special rules until the end of the player turn
Artefact.Description: One use only. The Potion of Foolhardiness can be drunk at the start of any player's turn. The imbiber has the Immune to Psychology and the Devastating Charge special rules until the end of the player turn.

Artefact.Name: Potion of Speed
Artefact.Rule: Once per battle at the start of any player's turn has +3 Initiative until the end of the turn
Artefact.Description: One use only. The Potion of Speed can be drunk at the start of any player's turn. The imbiber has +3 Initiative until the end of the turn.

HandWeapon.Name: Sunfang
HandWeapon.Rule: Once per battle, Tyrion can make a Strength 4 Breath Weapon attack with Flaming Attacks special rule

Individual.Rule: +1 to all attempts to cast spells from the Lore of High Magic

Arcane.Name: The Moon Staff of Lileath
Arcane.Rule: Onece per battle, for one Magic phases Teclis bonus power dice is added to every casting attempt or if Teclis suffers a miscast result of the miscast is ignored

Arcane.Name: Scroll of Hoeth
Arcane.Rule: One use only, same as Dispel scroll, in addition, both Teclis and the caster roll a D6: if Teclis scores higher, the spell cannot be reused by caster

Hero.Name: Eltharion the Grim
Hero.Description: Eltharion the Grim, Warden of Tor Yvresse

RangeWeapon.Name: Moonbow
RangeWeapon.Rule: Moonbow shoot for 36" with Strength 7, Multiple Wounds (D3), no Armour saves permitted and Quick to Fire secial rule
Any unit of Dark Elves that suffers one or more casualties from the Moonbow also suffers a -1 penalty to their Leadership until the end of the phase

Arcane.Name: Stone of Midnight
Arcane.Rule: Anyone shooting at Alith Anar suffers an additional penalty of -1 on the roll to hit

Hero.Name: Alarielle the Radiant
Hero.Description: Alarielle the Radiant, Everqueen of Ulthuan

Individual.Rule: +1 to all attempts to cast spells from the Lore of High Magic
At the start of each of Alarielle's Magic phases, every unit with the Daemonic special rule within 12" suffers D6 Strength 4 hits, distributed as for shooting attacks.

Arcane.Name: Star of Avelorn
Arcane.Rule: At the start of your Movement phase, nominate a single friendly character within 12" — that model immediately regains a single Wound lost earlier in the battie

Arcane.Name: Stave of Avelorn
Arcane.Rule: Once per battle, can cast a spell she has already cast that phase, even if the casting attempt failed, or was miscast

Arcane.Name: Horn of Isha
Arcane.Rule: Once per battle, all models in unit receive a +1 To Hit bonus on all shooting and close combat attacks

Arcane.Name: Banner of Avelorn
Arcane.Rule: Spells from the Lore of Light and the Lore of Life cast by a friendly Wizard that target a unit receive a +4 bonus to cast

Option.Name: Dragon armour
Option.Rule: Immune to all breath and all Flaming attacks

Individual.Rule: +1 to all attempts to cast spells from the Lore of High Magic
6+ Ward save against non-magical shooting attacks

Arcane.Name: Mark of Asuryan
Arcane.Rule: If Caradryan is killed in close combat, the model that killed Caradryan immediately suffers D6 wounds, with no armour save allowed

Option.Name: Dragon armour
Option.Rule: Immune to all breath and all Flaming attacks

Individual.Rule: +1 to all attempts to cast spells from the Lore of High Magic

Option.Name: Dragon armour
Option.Rule: Immune to all breath and all Flaming attacks

Individual.Rule: Any enemy unit in base contact has the Always Strikes Last special rule and suffers -1 to its Strength
Any enemy unit in base contact has the Always Strikes Last special rule and suffers -1 to its Strength
Any enemy unit in base contact has the Always Strikes Last special rule and suffers -1 to its Strength
